intro: Iberis lapeyrousii, commonly known as the Armenian candytuft, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia and Turkey. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
